decks.notes: This deck aims to aggressively overwhelm and outpace opponents with a low mana curve, utilizing cards such as Scorch Spitter and Fervent Champion to chip away at the opponent's life total quickly. The goal is to play multiple threats each turn, supported by the powerful Embercleave equipment to deal massive damage. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell boosts the damage output of all red sources, while the other creatures provide additional damage and board presence. The strategy is to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm opponents quickly with aggressive and powerful creatures. It heavily relies on using strong green creatures like Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig and Questing Beast to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provide additional support and card advantage. Overall, the goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and generating card advantage to control the board and outvalue opponents. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider with cards like Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck can trigger effects like Mayhem Devil and draw cards with Village Rites. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King serves as a powerful finisher, benefiting from sacrificing permanents. The deck aims to grind out opponents through attrition and resource advantage, all while maintaining control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon to generate value and create threats. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells, card draw, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes some tempo plays with Brazen Borrower and Nightpack Ambusher to apply pressure when needed. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient control and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of versatile removal spells, counter spells, and board wipes. The deck aims to stabilize the board using cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, while also generating card advantage with cards like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler and Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value and protection, while powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World can help close out the game.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck revolves around using a mix of control spells, ramp, and powerful threats to outlast and outvalue the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board, while also ramping into powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The combination of disruption, card advantage, and strong finishers allows the deck to control the game and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand, using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outlast opponents. The deck aims to stabilize the board with sweepers like Shatter the Sky and Omen of the Sea, before closing out the game with powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Teferi, Time Raveler. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a versatile companion, providing additional value with its flicker effect. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through card advantage and powerful control elements, while establishing a dominant board presence.

This UW Control deck focuses on generating card advantage, disrupting the opponent's game plan, and controlling the board with removal spells and counters. The deck aims to maintain a stable board presence while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to gain incremental advantages. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value by flickering permanents like Omen of the Sea and Elspeth Conquers Death. With a suite of removal, counters, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until they can secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells and abilities, using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Breeding Pool to manipulate the board state and outvalue your opponent. By ramping up with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, you can quickly reach your powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. With counterspells like Neutralize and Dovin's Veto, as well as board wipes like Shatter the Sky, you can keep your opponent's threats in check while deploying your own powerful creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Castle Garenbrig and mana dorks to play high-impact creatures like Questing Beast and Voracious Hydra. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures that have trample, reach, or other abilities to deal damage and disrupt the opponent's board state. Gemrazer provides additional removal and utility while Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provides card advantage and flexibility. The deck is designed to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and removal spells like Dovin's Veto. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to eventually overwhelm them with threats like Hydroid Krasis and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It focuses on controlling the game tempo and outvaluing the opponent in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Casualties of War to dominate the board and maintain advantage. It aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Cultivate to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The mana base is designed to support the Sultai colors of green, blue, and black efficiently, with strong fixing from lands like Fabled Passage and Zagoth Triome.

The deck focuses on maintaining board control and card advantage using powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Teferi, along with efficient removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while generating card advantage with Hydroid Krasis and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse adds another win condition by turning lands into creatures. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by controlling the board and preserving resources.

This mono black aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. The strategy is to play low-cost aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gutterbones to deal quick damage, while also utilizing removal spells like Eliminate and Murderous Rider to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Demonic Embrace to provide additional reach and disruption. The inclusion of cards like Castle Locthwain and Mobilized District enable the deck to maintain card advantage and present threats from multiple angles.

The main focus of this Simic Aggro deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Arboreal Grazer, Pollywog Symbiote, and Migratory Greathorn. By utilizing cards like Gemrazer and Scavenging Ooze, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining aggression. The inclusion of Castle Vantress and Castle Garenbrig provides additional utility and mana ramping capabilities. The deck culminates in the powerful finisher End-Raze Forerunners, allowing for a potential game-winning swing in the late game.

This deck focuses on using control spells and powerful planeswalkers to outlast and outmaneuver opponents. By utilizing cards like Shark Typhoon for threats, Elspeth Conquers Death for removal, and Teferi, Time Raveler for disruption, the deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace. With Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis for card advantage and life gain, the deck can outvalue opponents in the late game. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides ramp and threat, while Jolrael, Mwonvuli Recluse offers a win condition by turning lands into creatures.
